TA No. 3780-THA: North-Northeast Region Area Development Project 
 
Lapsing of Technical Assistance Approval 
 
 
1.  During the development of the Country Strategy and Program (CSP) Update, 2002-
2004, provision for  a project preparatory technical assistance (TA) for the North-Northeast 
Region Area Development Project was included.  A TA fact-finding mission was subsequently 
fielded  in  September  2001  and  held  discussions  with  the  officials  of  the  Public  Debt 
Management Office (PDMO), the National Economic and Social Development Board (NESDB), 
the Department of Highways, the National Statistics Office (NSO), local government authorities 
(LGAs),  and  stakeholder  groups.  The  Mission  reached  broad  understanding  with  the 
Government on the TA, with respect to its objectives, scope, cost estimates and financing plan, 
implementation arrangements, and terms of references for consulting services. The TA for $1.0 
million was processed and approved by the President on 26 November 2001. 
 
2.  Since approval of the Project, Thailand has reduced its foreign currency borrowing 
program, and the Ministry of Finance has intimated that, at this time, it does not intend to borrow 
for area development projects. 
 
3.  In accordance with Section 18 of the Operations Manual, the validity of a TA lapses 
automatically after 12 months from the date of approval unless the TA letter is signed or the 
validity is extended for a further period. In view of the reasons cited in para. 2, no request for 
extension of validity will be forthcoming and the TA automatically lapsed on 26 November 2002. 
 
4.  NESDB, as the Executing Agency, has been informed accordingly.
